intro: Delissea giffardii, commonly known as the Giffard's daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Delissea giffardii is often found in coastal regions and is well adapted to arid environments. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscaping.
